sourceMeaningMnemonic: There is a <radical>moon</radical> and a <radical>city</radical> inside your <kanji>lung</kanji>. Inside of your lung there is a city and above that city lies a moon. It’s a pretty sight, but also very strange. Moons and cities don’t usually reside inside lungs.
meaningInfo: Imagine having a moon and a city inside your lung. Feel their presence as you breathe in and breathe out. Also, <ja>月</ja> often refers to internal organs as well, so remember that when you see this kanji.
readingMnemonic: Having a moon and city inside your <kanji>lung</kanji> inspires you to write a <reading>hai</reading>ku (<ja>はい</ja>). Perhaps the city and moon are just metaphorical. Either way, a haiku is the best way to go about things here.
readingInfo:
The city and moon
Inside my lung, forgotten.
Where is the answer?

Or just think of your own haiku. Be creative!
